ci_support_linux_64_mpinompipython3.10._:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
mpi:
- nompi
mpich:
- '4'
numpy:
- '2'
openblas:
- 0.3.*
openmpi:
- '5'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.description:
ASAP is a tool for doing atomic-scale computer simulations
(mainly molecular dynamics) using classical potentials
(mainly Effective Medium Theory). It is intended to work
as an energy calculator in connection with the Atomic Simulation
Environment (ASE). However, some parts of the ASE are either
extended or reimplemented for reasons of efficiency and
ease-of-use on parallel computers.
about.summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale classical molecular dynamics within ASE.

about.summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale classical molecular dynamics within ASE.

name: asap3

about.description:
ASAP is a tool for doing atomic-scale computer simulations
(mainly molecular dynamics) using classical potentials
(mainly Effective Medium Theory). It is intended to work
as an energy calculator in connection with the Atomic Simulation
Environment (ASE). However, some parts of the ASE are either
extended or reimplemented for reasons of efficiency and
ease-of-use on parallel computers.
about.summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale classical molecular dynamics within ASE.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "asap3" %}
{% set version = "3.13.10" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e46147491d3a7219e9cc716fa7692d625a25f917169cc746832299cdad4dfee2

build:
  number: 0
  script:
    - echo "libraries += ['mpi']" >> customize.py  # [mpi != 'nompi'] 
    - echo "remove_compile_args += ['-march=native']" >> customize.py
    - {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  skip: true  # [win or py2k or (py < 310)]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - numpy
    - openblas
    - {{ mpi }}  # [mpi != 'nompi']
    - kim-api
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - openblas
    - ase >=3.24
    - {{ mpi }}  # [mpi != 'nompi']    
    - kim-api

test:
  requires:
    - {{ mpi }}  # [mpi != 'nompi']
  files:
    - Verlet*.pickle
    - hostfile
  source_files:
    - Test
  imports:
    - asap3
  commands:
    - cp Verlet*.pickle hostfile Test
    - cd Test
    - sed -i'.bak' -e 's/np.float)/float)/g' *.py parallel/*.py
    - python TestAll.py
    - mpirun -np 2 --hostfile hostfile python -W error::FutureWarning TestAll.py --parallel  # [mpi != 'nompi']

about:
  home: https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/asap
  license: LGPL-3.0-only
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: ASAP is a calculator for doing large-scale classical molecular dynamics within ASE.

  description: |
    ASAP is a tool for doing atomic-scale computer simulations
    (mainly molecular dynamics) using classical potentials
    (mainly Effective Medium Theory). It is intended to work 
    as an energy calculator in connection with the Atomic Simulation 
    Environment (ASE). However, some parts of the ASE are either 
    extended or reimplemented for reasons of efficiency and 
    ease-of-use on parallel computers.
  doc_url: https://wiki.fysik.dtu.dk/asap/Manual
  dev_url: https://gitlab.com/asap/asap

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jochym
